intro: Phyllanthus llanosii, commonly known as the Llanos phyllanthus, is a shrub native to South America, particularly found in regions of Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its botanical features include a woody stem, simple leaves with a smooth surface, and small, clustered inflorescences. It is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
